title: If you are on a winning streak
body:
You shouldn't get paired with horrible teammates. Let the downvotes begin but honestly it's stupid that i start going back into the groove of things and start doing better and winning more. Just to be paired with a bronze 1, and an unranked player? Go look at my 16/4/2 kat game, i did exceptionally well. The best on my team and i was the only one who went better than even. Everyone else was just feeding. Like ? How is that fair to me as a player? And if you say "oh well the other team must've had bad players too" then you are wrong. Sure the yasuo was bad in my eyes but they were all S5+. Fix your bullshit matchmaking please
/endrant


EDIT- Go look at my match history. i went from 0 lp to promos and then got really bad teammates that were clearly below my mmr

It's riot's way of controlling win percentages in my opinion. If you are on a winning streak, it's safe to say you probably have been playing well. So, instead of doing the proper thing and putting you up against (same lane) a tougher opponent, maybe someone who has also been on a winning streak, they kind of steal the show from you and give people that are just bad or are on a bad losing streak. It all correlates to their magic "50%" win percentage number. Just like balancing champions, they try to get as close to 50% as possible. So, unfortunately, I would recommend to just expect it. You win 3-4 in a row, you're going to get worse teammates, not face fiercer opponents.
I agree, but i also see it as, maybe its to break your teammates losing streak, by pairing them up with you.

Both would work to make a game balanced by MMR. Either your opponents get better or your team mates become worse or some combination of the two. However, you clearly do face better opponents and not just receive worse allies. We see this with challenger smurfs, who can go on very long win streaks, say 30+ games long. With 30 games, they'll probably be somewhere in D5 (conservative estimates here). On their 30th game, they're not playing with Bronze 5 allies because "Riot keeps giving them worse team mates" for every successive win they get. They're instead playing against players in D1+ while being D5.

This needs to be addressed.

I think we should start making daily threads about this and flood the board with them.

It makes no sense for this to happen.  If you're doing well the deck should NOT be stacked against you.

Overall MMR should be the only consideration that determines team mates not this phantom win/loss streak MMR bullshit.

I had the same thing happening to me this season. 
I was plat 5 before placements, 
Went back gold 3 after placements, 
Had ~65% winrate and a huge winstreak of 15 games, went up to plat 3 quite fast.
I was winning 30 LP per win, losing 15 per loss. 

Then it happened. Broken matchmaking streak. Literally each lane in my team would get destroyed, as in bronze vs. diamond lanes, while I was doing good, but nothing I could do. 
Went back to plat 5 0 LP. 
Now my MMR is tanked "Bad", and despite winrate > 50%, I am still winning ~16 LP, losing ~22 LP. 

So I just stopped League for a while. 


Looking back, I don't know if it is match-making or me tilting. 
I don't know because even though I always had nice KDA / kill participation / dmg to champ / dmg tanked, etc, etc... I know that many good players climb many account to challenger, so I don't think elo hell exist. 

Still, this happens and frustrates me: 
When your MMR is high, match-making doesn't match you with higher MMR against higher MMR.
It seems like instead, match-making match you with low MMR against high MMR, kind of to compensate. 
And it leads to unpleasant game, for everybody.
This is why ranked is a shit mode, the elo system broken, and why solo-queue is a joke.
